intro: Stickmannia micans, commonly known as the sparkling stickman, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical and subtropical species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that emit a faint, sweet fragrance. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Stickmannia micans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded woodland areas.
